reviewText: All these 5 star reviews are warranted.  the band is firing on all cylinders...Gary is back and sounds like its 1981 again, Simon Phillips is a beast behind the kit, Wayne Findley, what can be said about this guy, easily Michael's longest serving musical companion.  And Michael, WOW, he is spot on.  His playing hasn't been this lively since the Unforgiven World Tour over 10 years ago.  I seen him again on that 2004 tour, which that piece of sh*(i)*t dvd was released man his playing back then was pathetic, just too much substance abuse.  But not here, the sound, the editing, the video, the set list, the performance are all perfect especially on blu ray.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just wanted to make a correction  on one of the reviews,The drummer here in this concert is Simon Phillips not Simon Wright,still a pretty good review ,this Recording Quality shows how Michael sounds live,Am so glad that finally at last a great MSG DVD has been released,Schenker continues to carry the torch!ROCK WILL NEVER DIE!AXE'
summary: JUST A CORRECTION & A FEW WORDS ABOUT THE DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hooosh! At last, at last... At last a Schenker concert is captured adequately in video. The 1981 show in Hamburg is also good, but hti sone here is simply amazing.All the band is firing on all cylinders (to use an old cliche). The sound of Michael's Dean guitar is fantastic. Gary Barden is singing better than in the eighties, Neil Murray is bass player excellence itself, relatively modest and a little behind Barden and Schenker at the stage. Keyboardist/guitarist Wayne "Payl Raymond" Findlay does the job with enthusiasm. But man, that guy behind the drums... Simon Phillips is just a monster drummer. The guy knows everything. Just hearing/watching him play in this DVD is an experience in itself. The ultimate pro.The extras are also good, although absolutely nothing "profound" is said. To watch Phillips says that he did not even talk to Michael in the recording process of 2008's IN THE MIDST OF BEAUTY is incredible (digital file transfers).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like most Michael Schenker concerts, you can rely on hearing many of the most popular songs from across the band's catalog. In this case, singer Gary Barden and drummer Simon Phillips from the original MSG album, along with Neil Murray on bass and Wayne Findlay on rhythm guitar and keyboards, support Michael "Shredder" infusing new life and energy into a lot of timeless old songs. The audio and video quality of the Blu-Ray are absolutely amazing and the performances tie it all together for an unsurpassed live concert experience. Barden's voice is as strong as it ever was for those of you who might be wondering. This is so much better that the MSG 2004 World Tour DVD, which I bought when it was released, that I wish I could get my money back. A royal rock retrospective of MSG awaits you. Enjoy!
summary: Some of the Original Band Members Together Again
Title: N/A

reviewText: This couldn't be any better. The sound quality is LOUD and awesome, unlike most concert dvd's that even when the sound quaity is good, they don't seem loud enough. I had to actually turn this down from the norm because it was cranking. Not complaining though... I'll put this a nut-shell! This concert is perfect. The best concert dvd I have and have ever heard. Wish I could give it 10 stars. Michael has never been better and the band is awesome. And Gary Barden still sounds like he 25. Simon Phillips is amazing, and Neil Murray and Wayne Findlay are a perfect rythem team. I hope this line up stays together for a loooong time. It's a great surprise to get a concert dvd that really is awesome through and through. Can't wait to see them when they come around here. Just got word that I won 2 tickets. YEAH!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a new Schenker fan - I was instantly converted to one when I saw him play at the Key Club in Hollywood last year with a friend.  I was completely blown away by he and his band.  This Blu-ray disc is no exception.  They did a good job of showing Michael up close when he is playing the more complicated passages - his dexterity is amazing.  The audio mix is clear and balanced with good fidelity.  It is presented at 96khz/24bit so we get true hi rez video and audio with this disc.  Highly recommended for fans new and old.
summary: Excellent performance, great audio and video quality
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great addition to the MSG and/or UFO fan.  Lots to like here with many songs from the first two MSG releases.  The camera work and audio are very good.  Sometimes there are some missed opportunities where the camera angle is absent from Michael's fantastic finger work, but they are not too annoying and the video quality is excellent. Highly recommended!
Title: N/A

reviewText: To mark his thirty year anniversary as a solo artist, guitar maestro Michael Schenker took the 2010 version of the Michael Schenker Group (MSG) to Japan, to shoot a DVD which would become Michael Schenker Group - The 30th Anniversary Concert Live In Tokyo (2010).  The players include singer Gary Barden, drummer Simon Phillips, bass player Neil Murray (Whitesnake), and guitarist/keyboard player Wayne Findlay.  Barden and Phillips both played on MSG's debut albumThe Michael Schenker Groupreleased back in 1980, and they also played on MSG's 2008 albumIn The Midst of Beauty, along with Murray playing bass.This first class production is available in Bluray, and also regular DVD.  The venue in Tokyo, Japan is not that large, and the crowd is quite close to the stage.  Coverage of the band is very good, and while the editing is occasionally a little choppy, when Michael solos, the cameras are usually following what his fingers are doing, even if it involves cutting to several different shots.  MSG powers through 18 songs, including two encores, in a performance that runs about 103 minutes.Aside from the UFO classics "Rock Bottom" and "Doctor Doctor", the setlist consists primarily of material from the Barden era, which includes the first two MSG albums, the fourth, Built to Destroy, and In The Midst Of Beauty.  "A Night To Remember", and "I Want You", from the new album, are tough and aggressive tunes.  For the most part, the bulk of the songs are very familiar to most MSG fans, as through the years, there hasn't been a great deal of variety in what MSG plays live.  Besides excellent production values, what sets this release apart from other live performances likeWorldwide Live 2004, orMSG Live in Tokyo 1997, is that Gary Barden is back singing the songs he originally made popular, including some that may not be as familiar, like "Feels Like A Good Thing", "Lost Horizons", and "Victim Of Illusion".Barden might not have the greatest singing range, but his voice sounds as good as ever, showing little evidence of deterioration.  He seems to be in pretty good health, and for hardcore MSG fans, it's simply great to hear Gary singing "his" songs again, rather than someone else.Michael seems to be in tip top form, and in a very positive state of mind.  He's playing with fire in his belly, displaying finesse, and aggressiveness, as he wields has trademark Flying V.  While Schenker has occasionally been accused of being sloppy, that is certainly not the case here, as he is totally in the groove and having fun.Simon Phillips isn't the most physically imposing guy, but he is a fantastic drummer, who has played with many great bands, from Toto to Judas Priest.  Neil Murray hangs back out of the spotlight, and just plays a very solid bass guitar.  Having a rhythm guitar player is crucial to the live sound of MSG, and Wayne Findlay fills a key role as the "swingman", switching between keyboards and guitar.If you are a fan of the Gary Barden era MSG, you won't be disappointed by this release, which is highly recommended, particularly as Barden has since left MSG.  Another plus is the nearly 30 minutes of bonus material, that includes rehearsal footage, interviews, and backstage material from the performances in Japan.
summary: Schenker, Barden, and Phillips, make this a performance not to be missed by MSG fans...
Title: N/A
